resources.string: If a consonant is doubled(mellon), it is pronounced longer.\nIf above a vowel is a \'triangle\' or a \'dash\', then the vowel is pronounced longer than usual. It\'s called \'a long vowel\'.

In disyllabic words, the stress falls on the first syllable: Amar, thAla, sUIlad.
 
 
If the word has more than two syllables, the stress falls on the second from the end of the syllable, if the syllable is 'Long' (contains a long vowel, diphthong or is accompanied by doubled or more than one consonant): an√çradd, nelchAEnen, erchAmmui.(keep in mind that 'th' or 'ch' - are an one consonant).
 
 
If none of the above is present, the stress falls on the third syllable from the end: nIphredil, adAnedair.
